page.title: 04Tourism,Wye Valley.
page.content: The Tourist Information Centre at Tintern was started by demand in 1969 and has been open for 16 years.It serves the Wye Valley area and covers places of interest such as Tintern Abbey,Bigsweir Bridge area, St.Briavel's Castle and Offa's Dyke footpath. In a year the centre receives about 40,000 people.Many people from different countries visit the Wye Valley some of the countries include America, South Africa, Holland, Canada, New Zealand and Australia. They do not recommend particular hotels in the area but they do give information of accommodation available. There are not many official camping sites in our area, 2 unofficial ones can be found in Llandogo & Whitebrook on farms.
